content:
Is there a recommended way to reference value sets that come from PHIN VADS? For example: https://phinvads.cdc.gov/vads/ViewValueSet.action?oid=2.16.840.1.114222.4.11.7129

For now, we're referencing them with links like above, but the terminology server doesn't seem too happy with that approach. I suppose we could use urn:oid:2.16.840.1.114222.4.11.7129 -- but I'm not sure that's any better.
@Rob Hausam / @Robert McClure ?

When I did the OccupationalData resource originally (I think Chris may be working on the profile?) I had the same question and decided to use the urls. The terminology service doesn't currently support the urls or urns for expansions, etc., and PHIN VADS doesn't provide a FHIR API. So I don't think there's a great answer, but it would be good to work out a more robust general strategy for it as working with PHIN VADS will be common in some contexts.

@Rob Hausam -- thanks for the insight. @Mark Kramer is doing most of the work on the modeling, but I'm responsible for the tooling side that pumps out the IG. It sounds like this PHIN VADS value set resolution issue isn't like to be resolved (no pun intended) before the ballot. Agreed that we should figure out an accepted (and supported) way forward for referencing PHIN VADS URLs soon though.

@Grahame Grieve -- the only remaining errors on our ODH build (aside from one broken link) are errors about not being able to resolve PHIN VADS value sets:

pasted image

I assume those are "acceptable" errors for going to ballot? It doesn't seem there is any way around them.
the only way around them - which would be good if you can - is to put the correct value sets in the IG
but, btw, what's this 'going to ballot' - meant to ask you about this...

from the ballot desktop:
HL7 FHIR® Implementation Guide: Breast Cancer Data, Release 1: Postponed
noticed this while on the FMG call today
won't work till I commit - and I'm waiting for Josh
Well shoot. Postponed? That's news to me. I'll ask @Mark Kramer about it. He's been tracking it at that level. I would think that I would've heard about that though.
That said, the phin vads stuff is for this one:
HL7 FHIR® Profile: Occupational Data for Health (ODH), Release 1
